SIGN_UP.DESCRIPTION: Cuir isteach do shonraí teagmhála thíos agus roghnaigh "Ar Aghaidh" thíos chun an próiseas clárúcháin a chríochnú
SIGN_UP.DESCRIPTION_STEP_3: Cuir isteach na cóid thíos a fuarthas trí ríomhphost agus SMS, ansin roghnaigh Seiceáil. Cuir isteach do dháta breithe freisin. Nuair a bheidh do chóid deimhnithe, cliceáil ar Ar Aghaidh
SIGN_UP.TO_LOGIN: Cláraithe cheana féin, cliceáil anseo chun
SIGN_UP.TITLE: Críochnaigh clárúcháin
SIGN_UP.SUB_TITLE: Cuir isteach na sonraí seo a leanas le do chlárúcháin a chomhlánú.
SIGN_UP.AGREE_TERMS: Aontaím paschóid aonuaire (OTPanna) a fháil trí SMS agus ríomhphost
SIGN_UP.NEED_HELP: An bhfuil cabhair ag teastáil uait?
SIGN_UP.ALREADY_REGISTERED: Cláraithe cheana féin, cliceáil anseo chun
SIGN_UP.AGREE: Tuigim trí thic a chur sa bhosca seo go n-aontaím leis an {{terms}} an aip a úsáid
SIGN_UP.PASSWORDS_INFO: Ní mór litir chás uachtair amháin agus uimhir amháin a bheith sa phasfhocal
SIGN_UP.ACCOUNT_NUMBER_INFO:
Seo d’uimhir chustaiméara. Ba cheart go mbeifeá in ann é seo a fháil ar aon litir a sheol muid
                     chugat.
SIGN_UP.MFA_INFO:
Molaimid go láidir go roghnaíonn tú fíordheimhniú ilfhachtóiriúil (MFA). Feabhsóidh sé seo slándáil do chuntais.
Roghnaigh OTP SMS nó OTP Ríomhphoist. Gheobhaidh tú cód ansin le cur isteach gach uair a gheobhaidh tú rochtain ar an Tairseach GRÉASÁIN chun d'aitheantas a dhearbhú. Mura mian leat cód a fháil, roghnaigh Gan MFA. Ní mholtar é seo.
Is féidir leat do rogha a athrú am ar bith i do Phróifíl Tairsí GRÉASÁIN.

TERM_AND_CONDITIONS.TITLE: Terms and Conditions
TERM_AND_CONDITIONS.CONTENT_1: THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS APPLY TO AND GOVERN YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF SOUTH DUBLIN COUNTY COUNCIL MOBILE RENTS SERVICE APP
TERM_AND_CONDITIONS.CONTENT_2: IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOU READ AND UNDERSTAND OUR TERMS AND CONDITIONS AS BY DOWNLOADING THE APP YOU INDICATE THAT YOU ACCEPT THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS THEN DO NOT DOWNLOAD THE APP

STATE_1.TITLE: 1. Availability and registration
STATE_1.DESCRIPTION_1: We have made this SOUTH DUBLIN COUNTY COUNCIL MOBILE RENTS SERVICE (the App) available to you for your own personal use only and only for the purposes of facilitating your use of accessing your rent account online (the Service).
STATE_1.DESCRIPTION_2: You will not be able to use the App until you have completed the registration process.

STATE_2.TITLE: 2. Applicable terms
STATE_2.DESCRIPTION_1: Your use of the Service is governed by the terms and conditions at (the Service T&Cs). These App Terms and Conditions (the App T&Cs) supplement and amend the Service T&Cs in respect of your use of the App. By downloading the App you agree to comply with each of the Service T&Cs and the App T&Cs.
STATE_2.DESCRIPTION_2: We reserve the right to modify these App T&Cs as required. If these App T&Cs are modified, we will post a clear, easily accessible modification notification on the App. If you continue using the App, you will be bound by any or all modifications made to it.

STATE_3.TITLE: 3. Charges
STATE_3.DESCRIPTION: You may be charged by your service provider for downloading and/or accessing the App on your mobile phone, tablet or other handheld device (the Device). These may include data roaming charges if you do this outside your home territory. All these charges are solely your responsibility. If you do not pay the bills for your Device then we assume that you have the permission from the person that does before incurring any of these charges. We will not charge a separate fee for accessing the App, but you may be charged fees for using the Service. These fees will be as set out in the Service T&Cs.

STATE_4.TITLE: 4. Minimum system requirements
STATE_4.DESCRIPTION: The App will only work on compatible Devices and operating systems and certain functionality will only work if your Device is connected to the internet. Some features 	may also only be available with certain operating systems.

STATE_5.TITLE: 5. Use of your personal information
STATE_5.DESCRIPTION_1: Your personal information is processed under applicable law and controlled by SOUTH DUBLIN COUNTY COUNCIL. Details of the information we collect and how we use it, including where this is shared with third parties and/or processed outside the EEA, is as set out in the Service T&Cs.
STATE_5.DESCRIPTION_2: Through your use of the App we also collect and use touch ID, store your username, language selection, country selection and location data and our use of this personal information is subject to your opt-in choice and the applicable provisions in the Service T&Cs.
STATE_5.DESCRIPTION_3: Certain functionality of the App may need to access your Device and information stored on it so that it works properly. By using the App you consent to this.

STATE_6.TITLE: 6. Your use of the App
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_1: You must comply with these App T&Cs as these apply to your use of the App and the Service T&Cs apply to your use of the Service that you access and use through the App. Any violation of these App T&Cs or the Service T&Cs may result in the termination of your access to the App and/or the Service.
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_2: The may only use the App for your own personal use and not in connection with any commercial endeavours. You must not send it to anyone else or copy or modify any part of it in any way.
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_3: You must not attempt to extract any source code from the App, disassemble it or make any derivative versions, or attempt to interrupt or decipher the transmissions between the App and our systems.
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_4: You must not use the App for any of the following purposes:
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_5: (a) anything unlawful or illegal or which is fraudulent or malicious or which promotes any criminal activity or provides information about the same;
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_6: (b) anything which is defamatory, harassing or threatening or which otherwise infringes or violates the rights of others. This includes any information that you may add or upload to the App;
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_7: (c) interfering in any way with any other user of the App; and/or
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_8: (d) knowingly introducing viruses or other malicious or harmful material or using it in connection with unsolicited communications.
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_9: You must not use the App in a way that may damage or impair the App, the Service or our underlying systems and security.
STATE_6.DESCRIPTION_10: As the App facilitates money transfers, security is of paramount importance. You must keep your Device secure and properly close the App after each use. You must ensure that any security details, money transfer and account information and all other information that you provide to us via the App or otherwise is complete, accurate and up to date.

STATE_7.TITLE: 7. Intellectual property rights
STATE_7.DESCRIPTION: The App and all copyright, database rights, trade marks and other intellectual property rights related to it belong to us or our licensors.

STATE_8.TITLE: 8. Our responsibilities to you
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_1: While we will endeavour to ensure that the App is normally available 24 hours a day, we shall not be liable if for any reason the App is not available at any time or for any period. Access to the App may be suspended temporarily from time to time and without notice in the case of system failure, maintenance or repair or for any reason beyond our control or if we deem it necessary.  For the avoidance of doubt, we shall not be liable for any loss or liability which may be suffered or incurred by you as a result of any suspension of, or interruption to, the operation of the App.
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_2: The App, including all content on or available through the App, is provided on an ‘as is’ basis and we do not make any representation or give any warranty in respect of the App or any of its content.  In particular, but without limitation, we do not give any warranty as to the accuracy, suitability, reliability, completeness, performance, fitness, freedom from viruses or timeliness of the content contained on the App.  The content of the App is not intended as advice and should not be relied upon.
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_3: We do not accept any responsibility to you for:
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_4: (a) malfunctions in communications facilities which cannot reasonably be considered to be under our control and that may affect the accuracy or timeliness of messages you send or the material you access via the App;
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_5: (b) any losses or delays in transmission of messages or material you access arising out of the use of any Internet access service provider or mobile network service provider or caused by any browser or other software which is not under our control;
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_6: (c) viruses that may infect your computer equipment or other property on account of your access to or use of the App or your accessing any materials on the App;
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_7: (d) any unauthorised use or interception of any message or information before it reaches the App or our servers from the App;
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_8: (e) any unauthorised use of or access to data relating to you or your transactions which is held by us (unless such use or access is caused by our negligence, fraud or failure to comply with laws relating to the protection of your data), to the extent permitted by local law;
STATE_8.DESCRIPTION_9: (f) any content provided by third parties.

STATE_9.TITLE: 9. Limitations of liability
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_1: There are provisions on liability in the Service T&Cs that also apply in connection with these App T&Cs and your use of the App.
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_2: In addition, we and our group companies and our and their officers, directors, employees, shareholders or agents, exclude all liability and responsibility for any amount or kind of loss or damage that may result to you or a third party (including without limitation, any direct, indirect, punitive or consequential loss or damages, or any loss of income, profits, goodwill, data, contracts, use of money, or loss or damages arising from or connected in any way to business interruption, and whether in tort (including without limitation negligence), contract or otherwise) in any way or in connection with:
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_3: (a) the App and your  use, delay in use or inability to use the App or if it does not work as you expect or would like or if it contains any defects or errors and whether or not we correct any of those defects or errors;
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_4: (b) your access to and use of any material on the App or material linked to or referred to on the App; and/or
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_5: (c) any loss or damage to your Device or any other hardware or software you use in connection with the App, including in connection with any viruses that may affect the same on account of your downloading and use of the App.
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_6: You acknowledge that use of the App is dependent on third parties, including your own network providers, and that we are not liable for any acts or omissions of those third parties.
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_7: If we or any of our group companies or our or their officers, directors, employees, shareholders or agents do have any liability to you for any kind of loss or damage for any reason under or in connection with these App T&Cs and/or the Service T&Cs, you agree that you shall not recover more than once for that same loss and/or damage regardless of whether your claim(s) are made under or in connection with any or both of these App T&Cs and/or the Service T&Cs.
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_8: Nothing in these App T&Cs shall exclude any party’s liability for: (a) death or personal injury arising through negligence; (b) fraudulent misrepresentation; and/or (c) anything else that cannot be excluded or limited by us under any applicable law.
STATE_9.DESCRIPTION_9: You shall indemnify us (and you shall keep us indemnified) and hold us and our directors, employees, agents and representatives harmless against any claim, loss, expense, liability or damages suffered by us resulting from your breach of these App T&Cs.

STATE_10.TITLE: 10. Termination and suspension
STATE_10.DESCRIPTION: We may terminate or suspend your use of the App with or without notice at any time and without any liability to you. Upon any termination your right to use the App, and any other rights or permissions granted to you in these App T&Cs, will end and you must stop using the App and delete it from your Device.

STATE_11.TITLE: 11. Law and jurisdiction
STATE_11.DESCRIPTION: These App T&Cs and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with them or their subject matter (including any non-contractual disputes or claims) will be governed by the law of Ireland and the parties agree that the courts of Ireland will have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any such disputes or claims.

LABELS.NAME: Ainm
LABELS.PASSWORDS_INFO: Ní mór litir chás uachtair amháin agus uimhir amháin a bheith sa phasfhocal. Ba chóir go mbeadh sé ar a laghad 10 gcarachtar ar fad.

MFA.ENTER_EMAIL_OTP: Cuir isteach an OTP a fuarthas ar ríomhphost
MFA.ENTER_PHONE_OTP: Cuir isteach an OTP a fuarthas ar d'fhón
MFA.DESCRIPTION: Fíoraigh do sheoladh ríomhphoist agus uimhir theileafóin.
MFA.ENTER_INFO:
Mar chuid de do rogha Fíordheimhnithe Ilfhachtóiriúil (MFA) roghnaithe, gheobhaidh tú cód chuig d’uimhir fón póca fíoraithe nó chuig do sheoladh ríomhphoist, cuir isteach é seo thíos.

Is féidir leat do rogha MFA roghnaithe a leasú i do phróifíl chuntais.
MFA.EXISTING_TENANT_INFO: Is próiseas aonuaire é seo chun do shonraí teagmhála a dhearbhú. Cuir isteach do shonraí thíos agus roghnaigh {{button}} chun an próiseas fíoraithe a chríochnú
MFA.EXISTING_TENANT_INFO_2: Cuir isteach na cóid atá faighte agat trí SMS agus ríomhphost agus roghnaigh “seiceáil” do gach cód. Ansin brúigh Leanúint ar aghaidh.
MFA.EXISTING_TENANT_INFO_3: Molaimid go láidir go roghnaíonn tú fíordheimhniú ilfhachtóiriúil (MFA). Feabhsóidh sé seo slándáil do chuntais. Roghnaigh OTP SMS nó OTP Ríomhphoist. Gheobhaidh tú cód ansin le cur isteach gach uair a gheobhaidh tú rochtain ar an Tairseach GRÉASÁIN chun d'aitheantas a dhearbhú. Mura mian leat cód a fháil, roghnaigh Gan MFA. Ní mholtar é seo. Is féidir leat do rogha a athrú am ar bith i do Phróifíl Tairsí GRÉASÁIN
MFA.AGREE: Aontaím paschóid aonuaire (OTPanna) a fháil trí SMS agus ríomhphost.
MFA.INFO: Molaimid go láidir go roghnaíonn tú fíordheimhniú ilfhachtóiriúil (MFA). Feabhsóidh sé seo slándáil do chuntais.

PAYMENT_INFO.TITLE: Eolas Breise
PAYMENT_INFO.DESCRIPTION_1: Tá an Treoir Eorpach nua ar íocaíochtaí (PSD2) i bhfeidhm anois.
PAYMENT_INFO.DESCRIPTION_2:
Is é príomhaidhm na Treorach seo ná calaois íocaíochta ar líne a laghdú. Teastaíonn uainn tuilleadh
             uainn chun an t-idirbheart a chur i gcrích.
PAYMENT_INFO.DESCRIPTION_3:
Ná bíodh drogall ort na sonraí thíos a athrú chun an cárta a úsáidfear chun an t-idirbheart seo a chur i gcrích a mheaitseáil.
             Cliceáil ar lean ar aghaidh nuair a mheaitseálann na sonraí thíos sonraí an chárta.

PAYMENT.ENTER_AMOUNT: Cuir isteach an méid atá le híoc

POPUP.TITLE: Úsáideann an Suíomh Gréasáin seo fianáin.
POPUP.CONTENT: Ní úsáideann ISC ÍCT ach fianáin ar an suíomh gréasáin seo agus ar an bhfeidhmchlár seo atá fíor-riachtanach le haghaidh seirbhísí a iarrann tú. Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach ar ár Ráiteas um Chosaint Sonraíagus Ráiteas Fianáin.

DATA_PROJECTION.SUBTITLE: Tairseach WebPay ÍCT
DATA_PROJECTION.TITLE: Ráiteas um Chosaint Sonraí le haghaidh

INTRODUCTION.CONTENT: Cruthaíodh an ráiteas um chosaint sonraí seo don tairseach Íocaíocht Cúnaimh Tithíochta (“ÍCT”) WebPay (“WebPay”).

ABOUT.HEADER: Who we are and why do we require your information?
ABOUT.CONTENT1: The HAP Scheme is a social housing support scheme, established by the Government of Ireland within the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage (the “DHLGH”). The DHPLG in conjunction with the Local Authorities of Ireland are the data controllers for the HAP scheme.
ABOUT.CONTENT2: he data controllers established the Housing Assistance Payment Shared Service Centre (“HAP SSC”), to provide specific financial transactional and reporting services on behalf of all Local Authorities and the DHLGH.
ABOUT.CONTENT3: The HAP SSC is part of Limerick City and County Council and acts as a data processor for the data controllers.
ABOUT.CONTENT4: The WebPay portal has been created as a way for people who are participating in HAP to view the transactions in their account with their Local Authority and to make online payments.

WHY_STATEMENT.HEADER: Why do we have a data protection statement?
WHY_STATEMENT.CONTENT: HAP SSC has created this data protection statement in order to demonstrate our firm commitment to data protection and to assure you that in all your dealings with HAP SSC that we will ensure the security of the data you provide to us. HAP SSC creates, collects and processes a significant amount of personal data in various multiple formats on a daily basis. HAP SSC’s commitment is that the personal data you may be required to supply is:

LIST.ITEM1: Obtained lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner
LIST.ITEM2: Obtained for only specified, explicit and legitimate purposes
LIST.ITEM3: Adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary for purpose for which it was obtained
LIST.ITEM4: Recorded, stored accurately and securely and where necessary kept up to date
LIST.ITEM5: Kept only for as long as is necessary for the purposes for which it was obtained
LIST.ITEM6: Kept in a form which permits identification of the data subject
LIST.ITEM7: Processed only in a manner that ensures the appropriate security of the personal data including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing

POLICY.CONTENT: HAP SSC has a detailed Data Protection Policy which outlines how we as a public body are committed to ensuring the security of any personal data you provide to us.

ACTIVITY_REFERRED.HEADER: What is the activity referred to in this Data Protection Statement?
ACTIVITY_REFERRED.CONTENT1: The HAP SSC, as data processor, needs to process certain personal data in order to provide the WebPay portal. If you wish to make a card payment within the WebPay portal then you will need to provide card details to our card payment partner.
ACTIVITY_REFERRED.CONTENT2: The WebPay portal will validate the email address that you use and may be used to communicate with you concerning your HAP account.

WHAT_IS_THE_BASIC.HEADER: What is the basis for making the processing of personal data in this activity lawful?
WHAT_IS_THE_BASIC.CONTENT1: The processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller (Article 6(e) GDPR); the official authority is based on

LIST.ITEM3: Housing Authorities Functions under the Housing Acts 1966 to 2014

WHAT_IS_THE_BASIC.CONTENT2: The Data Controllers have concluded a Data Processing Agreement with Limerick City and County Council – HAP SSC, as the Data Processor. A separate data sharing agreement has been concluded with Global Payments Inc trading as Realex Payments. Realex Payments act as a data controller and are responsible for processing your card payments.

WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.HEADER: What personal data will be processed within the WebPay portal?
WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT: In order to provide the WebPay portal service the following personal data will be transferred securely from the existing systems of HAP SSC
WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT1: The WebPay portal can be used to make card payments. These payments can be either credit or debit card. If you choose to use this option then you will be transferred to the website of our card payment partner, Realex Payments. The WebPay portal will pass sufficient information to Realex Payments to allow them to identify you, including
WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT2: Realex Payments will securely process your card payment, including

LIST3.ITEM4: Card Verification Value (“CVV”) number – this is the 3 digit number on your card, and

WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT3: Your payment card details will not be shared with your Local Authority or with HAP SSC. Once Realex Payments have confirmed the transaction, the receipt details (amount and status) will be passed back to the WebPay portal and saved. Your receipt will then be transferred back to your account in the financial records of HAP SSC.
WHAT_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT4: The WebPay portal also uses cookies and you can find out more about how cookies work in the WebPay portal by looking at our WebPay portal cookie statement.

IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.HEADER: Is the personal data submitted as part of this activity shared with other organisations?
IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT1: The receipt transaction created when you make a card payment will be stored in the WebPay Portal. The receipts transactions will be written back to our main financial systems and stored as part of your account history. Your card payment information is not stored within the WebPay portal.
IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT2: Your account history will be available to other public bodies where processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the data controller is subject. This may include your Local Authority and the Department of Housing, Planning and Local Government.
IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT3: Other secondary controllers and processors to carry out processing on behalf of the data controller e.g. ICT support contractors i.e. Realex Payments and Ascendas Business Solutions.
IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT4: In this activity, if the personal data is to be transferred to a different country, it will be transferred to the following countries (if there are no countries listed, it is not intended to transfer the personal data abroad).

LIST.ITEM1: Realex Payments is a brand of Global Payments Inc., a multinational business headquartered in the United States. Realex Payments are a data controller and further information about their data processing and any international data transfers are provided on Realex Payments own websites.

HOW_LONG_IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.HEADER: How long is this personal data held by HAP SSC?
HOW_LONG_IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT1: The HAP SSC will only retain your personal data as determined by the data controllers for as long as it is necessary for the purposes for which they were collected and subsequently processed, and in line with certain statutory requirements, where relevant.
HOW_LONG_IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT2: The data controller will advise when the personal data is no longer required and instruct the HAP SSC to destroy or delete it in a secure manner.
HOW_LONG_IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT3: The data processed as part of this activity will be retained for the following period(s):
HOW_LONG_IS_THE_PERSONAL_DATA.CONTENT4: Records are to be maintained in line with the Data Controllers records management policy.

WHAT_WILL_HAPPEN_IF.HEADER: What will happen if the requested personal data is not provided?
WHAT_WILL_HAPPEN_IF.CONTENT: It will not be possible to provide you with the card payment service in the WebPay portal if you do not wish to provide your name, contact details and your card number, expiry date and CVV. Local Authorities and HAP SSC provide a number of other payment options. You can get more information about payment options at our website -

FURTHER_INFORMATION.CONTENT: You can obtain further information about

LIST.ITEM1: the HAP Scheme at our website;
LIST.ITEM2: contact details for each Local Authority;
LIST.ITEM3: the data processing carried out by Limerick City and County Council;

YOUR_DATA_PROTECTION_RIGHTS.CONTENT:
To the extent that the HAP SSC as Data Processor processes your personal data for or on behalf of the Data Controllers, the Data Processor undertakes to notify the relevant Data Controller if it receives any complaint, notice or communication which relates directly or indirectly to the processing of your personal data or to compliance with applicable Data Protection Law and provide the Data Controller with full co-operation and assistance in relation to any such complaint, notice or communication.
                The HAP SSC as Data Processor can provide you with the relevant contact details for your relevant Local Authority (Data Controller).
YOUR_DATA_PROTECTION_RIGHTS.CONTENT1: You have the right to request access to personal data held about you, obtain confirmation as to whether data concerning you exists, be informed of the content and source of data and check its accuracy. In addition, if the data held by us is found to be inaccurate you have the right to change, remove, block, or object to the use of, personal data held by your Local Authority, which is shared with HAP SSC. You also have the right to data portability. In certain circumstances blocking access to data may delay or remove access to a service where the data is required by law or for essential purposes related to delivery of a service to you. To exercise these rights, you should contact HAP SSC at the following address:

RIGHT_OF_COMPLAINT.HEADER: Right of Complaint to the Data Protection Commission
RIGHT_OF_COMPLAINT.CONTENT: If you are not satisfied with the outcome of the response you received from HAP SSC in relation to your request, then you are entitled to make a complaint to the Data Protection Commission who may investigate the matter for you.
RIGHT_OF_COMPLAINT.CONTENT1: The Data Protection Commission’s website is www.dataprotection.ie or you can contact their office at:

COOKIE_PAGE.TITLE: HAP WebPay Portal
COOKIE_PAGE.CONTENT:
Introduction

This cookie statement has been created for the Housing Assistance Payment (“HAP”) WebPay Portal (WebPay”).

This cookie statement provides information about the use of cookies and similar technologies when someone uses the WebPay Portal and your rights. If you are looking for information about the data processing within the WebPay Portal then please go to the data protection statement.

Who we are and why do we require your information?

The HAP Scheme is a social housing support scheme, established by the Government of Ireland within the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage (the “DHLGH”). The DHPLG in conjunction with the Local Authorities of Ireland are the data controllers for the HAP scheme.

The data controllers established the Housing Assistance Payment Shared Service Centre (“HAP SSC”), to provide specific financial transactional and reporting services on behalf of all Local Authorities and the DHLGH.

The HAP SSC is part of Limerick City and County Council and acts as a data processor for the data controllers.

The WebPay portal has been created as a way for people who are participating in HAP to view the transactions in their account with their Local Authority and to make online payments.The WebPay portal has been created as a way for people who are participating in HAP to view the transactions in their account with their Local Authority and to make online payments.

Why do we have a cookie statement?

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This cookie statement is to give you more information about our use of cookies and similar technologies and let you know what rights you have.

What information do we store when you visit the WebPay Portal?

Cookies can take a variety of forms. The WebPay Portal website uses the following types of cookie technologies:

Browser Cookies

A cookie is a small piece of data (text file) that a website – when visited by a user – asks your browser to store on your device in order to remember this information. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Those cookies are set by us and called first-party cookies.

Local storage

Local Storage is a type of web storage that allows websites and apps to store and access data right in the browser with no expiration date. This means the data stored in the browser will persist even after the browser window has been closed. The WebPay Portal needs to store essential information on your device in order to operate. The WebPay Portal will access this information whenever you login to WebPay.

What do we use cookies for?

The WebPay Portal uses only cookies and other technologies that are strictly necessary for the services requested by you and to make it operate safely and efficiently. We do not set any functional, performance, analytical, tracking or advertising cookies.

Strictly Necessary Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

Cookie name Cookie Purpose Lifespan Owner
Recaptcha This cookie ensures that only our customers can reset their passwords and prevents automated reset password attempts. One Year First Party

Local storage

The following local storage items will appear on your device

Host Key Purpose Lifespan
Happayments.limerick.ie userName This records your user name Persistent
Happayments.limerick.ie isLogged Who is logged in Persistent
Happayments.limerick.ie isShowHint Password hint Persistent
Happayments.limerick.ie token This is a unique ID for the session Persistent
Happayments.limerick.ie cookieBanner This records whether you have seen the cookie banner Persistent

Device data Collection and use of technical information

WebPay uses session cookies that we transfer to your computer for the duration of your visit. We use the session cookie to track your progress through the site, allowing us to maintain the security and integrity of the data being used. Technical details in connection with visits to this website are logged by our internet service provider for our statistical purposes. The technical details logged are confined to the following items:

  • the IP address of the visitor's web server
  • the top-level domain name used (for example .i.e, .com, .org, .net)
  • the previous website address from which the visitor reached us, including any search terms used
  • data which show the traffic of visitors around this web site
  • the type of web browser used by the website visitor. WebPay will make no attempt to identify individual visitors, or to associate the technical details listed above with any individual

This information is only used for technical purposes and not used for any further processing purposes.

Controlling cookies

The WebPay Portal will only work if the strictly necessary cookies and local storage operate as intended. You can clear these after you have left the WebPay Portal as follows:

How to clear browser cookies

If you'd like to find out how to stop websites using cookies to remember what websites you visit, choose your browser from the list. This will take you to the browser's respective page where you can learn how to manage your cookies and site data:

  • Chrome
  • Safari
  • Firefox
  • Internet Explorer

How to clear local storage

  • Open the Google Chrome Console by pressing F12 key
  • Select “Application” in the console’s top menu
  • Select “Local Storage” in the console’s left menu
  • Right click your site(s) and click clear to delete the local storage

Similar options are available in other browsers.

Further information

You can obtain further information about

  • the HAP Scheme at our website; www.hap.ie
  • contact details for each Local Authority; www.hap.ie/localauthorities/
  • the data processing carried out by the HAP SSC; www.hap.ie/privacy
    Please be aware that a different set of cookies will be processed when you go to the HAP.ie website, you can obtain more information about the cookies on the HAP.ie website
  • the data processing carried out by Limerick City and County Council; www.limerick.ie/council/services/your-council/privacy-statement-limerick-city-and-county-council

Your Data Protection Rights

To the extent that the HAP SSC as Data Processor processes your personal data for or on behalf of the Data Controllers, the Data Processor undertakes to notify the relevant Data Controller if it receives any complaint, notice or communication which relates directly or indirectly to the processing of your personal data or to compliance with applicable Data Protection Law and provide the Data Controller with full co-operation and assistance in relation to any such complaint, notice or communication. The HAP SSC as Data Processor can provide you with the relevant contact details for your relevant Local Authority (Data Controller).

You have the right to request access to personal data held about you, obtain confirmation as to whether data concerning you exists, be informed of the content and source of data and check its accuracy. In addition, if the data held by us is found to be inaccurate you have the right to change, remove, block, or object to the use of, personal data held by your Local Authority, which is shared with HAP SSC. You also have the right to data portability. In certain circumstances blocking access to data may delay or remove access to a service where the data is required by law or for essential purposes related to delivery of a service to you. To exercise these rights, you should contact Limerick City and County Council at the following address:

email: dataprotectionofficer@limerick.ie
Data Protection Officer,
Limerick City and County Council,
Merchants Quay,
Limerick

Right of Complaint to the Data Protection Commission

If you are not satisfied with the outcome of the response you received from Limerick City and County Council in relation to your request, then you are entitled to make a complaint to the Data Protection Commission who may investigate the matter for you.

The Data Protection Commission’s website is www.dataprotection.ie or you can contact their office at:

Lo Call Number: 1890 252 231
E-mail: info@dataprotection.ie

Postal Address:
Data Protection Commission
Canal House
Station Road
Portarlington
Co. Laois. R32 AP23

Last updated December 2020

STATEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Anseo is féidir leat sonraí gluaiseachta do chuntais go léir a fheiceáil, scagadh de réir maoine agus raon dátaí.
